page.shortlink: api regex literal mask get function
page.syntax: C REGEX_LITERAL_MASK_GET(RegEx as c[,PlaceHolder as c[,options as c]])

argument.name: PlaceHolder
argument.description: Placeholder to plug in the dynamic parts of a regular expression.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options for matching - only option at this point is '+' to expand ranges, which are normally collapsed.

description.p: Get the literal characters from a regular expression - puts in optional placeholder for characters. The purpose is to extract out the parts of a regular expression which could be considered parts of a 'template'.
The purpose of this function is to allow regular expressions brought in to be converted to input templates.

page.example:
? regex_literal_mask_get("hello (a-z+) what a (a-z+) day","{tag}","+") = "hello {tag} what a {tag} day"
' A regex pattern that resembles a phone number - note that there is one placeholder per dynamic run ? regex_literal_mask_get("[0-9]-\([0-9]{1,3}\) [0-9]{1,3} [0-9]{1,4}","{digit}","") = "{digit}-({digit}) {digit} {digit}"
' The same pattern, but with a placholder for the maxed out range. ? regex_literal_mask_get("[0-9]-\([0-9]{1,3}\) [0-9]{1,3} [0-9]{1,4}","{digit}","+") = "{digit}-({digit}{digit}{digit}) {digit}{digit}{digit} {digit}{digit}{digit}{digit}"
